answerText: Southern blot[10] In the first step of a Southern blot, these enzymes, which recognize specific sequences,cut DNA into smaller fragments. EcoR1 and HindIII are oft-used examples.
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 10 | 17 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The zoo and garden varieties of this technique compare the similarities in sequence between similar animal and plant species, respectively. [10] Name this technique in which a probe hybridizes to DNA that has been transferred to a nitrocellulose membrane. It isn't actually named for a cardinal direction, rather being named for a British biologist.
